result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy Lee Meyer Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: $220.00 cash bond was applied to court costs.

Not possess or consume any alcohol or illegal drugs. 
Not enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. 
Submit a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge. 
Enter and complete any correctional programming deemed appropriate by his agent. 
Not to associate with any known drug dealers or users. 
Pay all court cost/fines associated with these cases.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Pierce County 14CF173 and St Croix County 15CF99
Defendant is eligible for CIP and any other substance abuse programming in prison.

3:38 Defendant Randy Lee Meyer in court with attorney Alex Stormont.  Defendant Randy Lee Meyer in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF188 heard at this time. Thorie: 1 year jail on 14CF173 and 14CF188, concurrent with each other and with St Croix County. Atty Stormont argues sentencing; joint agreement to 1 year jail concurrent.  Def addresses the court. Credit 165 days on each case.  Court: 1 year jail on 14CF173 and 14CF188, concurrent with each other and with the St Croix County case. Credit with 165 days  on both cases. (15cF99 St Croix County Case) Eligle for CIP and any substance abuse programming in prison.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

Defendant Randy Lee Meyer in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 14CF188.  Thorie - reviewed PSI - probation for 3 years, concurrent on both cases, conditions as set forth in PSI, conditional jail time - 90 day recommendation.  Loberg - in agreement with 3 years probation and conditional jail.  Meyer addresses the court regarding sentencing.  Court orders S/W, 3 years probation concurrent on both cases, all conditions as set forth in PSI, DNA sample and surcharge.  $515 court costs including DNA surcharge on one case, court costs of $265 on other case, 90 days jail commencing immediately.  Appeal rights given to defendant.
Sentencing hearing at 11-02-2015 10:30 am.

Defendant Randy Lee Meyer appears via videoconferencing from Jail with Attorney Christopher Bub.  DA Sean Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called at 3:32 p.m.  Includes 14CF173 and 14CF188.  Defendant failed to appear for Sentencing on August 4, 2015.  State moves to quash warrant and reschedule sentencing.  No objection from Atty. Bub.  Court quashes warrants and obtains Atty. Loberg's office for scheduling.  Bond reinstated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.

3:08 pm  
Defendant Randy Lee Meyer in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ with attorney Joshua Hargrove by phone.  Defendant Randy Lee Meyer in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant has copy of complaint.  Charges read to the defendant by the Court Commissioner.    Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Hargrove - def lives in St Paul, MN.  Asks for higher signature bond or $150 cash or less.  Def is looking at treatment issues.  Thorie responds with public safety issue.  Def asks about cash bond.  $500 cash bond stands.  Def has $220 in his account.  State - Court can revist.  Court asks about fulltime employment.  Court changes bond to $220 cash.  Def will be working in Faribault for his uncle.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
